meanings.definition: Not able to be employed or hired.
meanings.sent1: The company decided the applicant was unhirable due to their lack of experience.
meanings.sent2: She was deemed unhirable for the position because she did not meet the educational requirements.
meanings.sent3: It was quite comical how the cat thought it was unhirable for the role of a dog walker.
meanings.sent4: The old, rusty machine was unhirable, resembling a relic from a forgotten era.
meanings.sent5: The dark storm clouds looming overhead made the picnic area look unhirable for the day.

meanings.definition: Not suitable or qualified for a job.
meanings.sent1: The manager found the candidate unhirable after discovering their lack of necessary skills.
meanings.sent2: The intern was considered unhirable for the permanent position due to their frequent tardiness.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a penguin applying for a job as a desert tour guide seemed unhirable but amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her outdated resume made her appear unhirable in the competitive job market.
meanings.sent5: The broken compass was unhirable for navigation, leading the hikers astray in the forest.
